definition: To designate or appoint someone to a specific position or role, typically in a formal or official context. This verb is commonly used when referring to the act of officially naming someone to a position of authority, such as appointing someone to a job, office, or honor.

examples.german: Ich werde ihn zum Direktor ernennen.
examples.english: I will appoint him as the director.

examples.german: Der Präsident ernannte sie zur Botschafterin.
examples.english: The president appointed her as the ambassador.
He was appointed as a professor.

examples.german: Die Königin ernannte ihn zum Ritter.
Der Chef ernannte ihn zum stellvertretenden Geschäftsführer.
examples.english: The boss appointed him as the deputy managing director.
